context: The word 'ameerikas' is the Estonian noun for 'America', referring to the country. It can be used in various grammatical cases, such as nominative (Ameerikas), elative (Ameerikast - from America), and partitive (Ameerikat - of/for America). The dictionary definition mentions it can refer to an American person specifically when combined with 'elav neeger' (living negro) in the context describing Afro-Americans, but primarily it refers to the country itself.
